label: 葛城山
本: The Tale of Genji (Penguin Classics) . Viking Adult . 2001
説明文: A range of mountains south of present Osaka.  Kazuraki was known for wizards and wonder workers, since En no Gyōja (late 7th c.), the half-legendary founder of the mountain ascetic tradition in Japan, came from there.  In modern Japanese the name is read Katsuragi.[葛城、役の行者][RK]
